body:
On Fri, Mar 13, 2015 at 6:07 PM, shrimpywu <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> thanks for everyone`s reply, i am trying to find out what are the minimum
> set of file for go environment. most of the folder does self exlained
> themself, but folder like "lib" and "include" still confused me, see blow:
>
If you want a minimum go distribution, take a look at
https://github.com/adg/gostrip

lib/time is needed on windows, plan9 and testing the time package.
lib/codereivew is not needed, this is gone starting from Go 1.5.

include is only needed if you need to rebuild the C part of the Go
toolchain, and
this directory is gone starting from Go 1.5.
